comments:
The bug happens when I try to update my RCP platform with the eclipse update
plugin ( sometimes even if I update directly with the exported feature.zip ).
When the workbench restarts the classloader of my plugins bundle fails to find
anything within a fragment of the plugin ( the fragment was NOT updated, it just
contains a JDBC driver ). 
Sometimes the workbenchs even throw errors that it couldn't register popup
actions that were removed with the update ( they are not within the new
plugin.xml anymore ) !

( The class jdbcDriver is from a jar within the fragment, the error happens
during the startup of the main plugin )

What build of eclipse 3.0 are you using?  

I suspect the host does not have singleton specified in the bundle manifest.  
Can you run the osgi console commane "headers" on all of your bundle IDs (in 
your example that would be 5, 6, and 25) and post the results?  Singletons may 
have not been implemented in the build you are using.

I'm using Eclipse 3 Milestone 8.
Both my plugin and my fragment are running with the runtime-compatiblity module.

Does version 1.0.1 of the EclipseClient2 plugin have any extensions or 
extension points?  It should have been marked as singleton=true in the Bundle-
SymbolicName header.  It is not and that is what is allowing both versions of 
the EclipseClient2 bundle to be resolved at the same time.  It think that is 
what is causing your problems.

My plugin has no extension points of it's own. ( I'm only using UI extension
points within my plugin.xml, plus the application extension point of course ).

Where can I set this "singleton=true" in my plugin.xml ?

Alot has changed in this area.  Can you try your scenario with a recent 
integration build?  Last week's would likely do but this week's (today's) would 
be even better.

Please try again with RC0 and let us know ASAP.
However make sure that you install RC0 in a new folder (not overlaid on top of
something else).

If you still have a problem, run with -debug and analyze the content of the .log
file to check if all the bundles are properly resolved. 
If you are more adventureous you can try to put a breakpoint in the run(Object)
method of EclipseStarter. More precisely on the line: return
application.run(argument);

Setting to RC1 in case this is a problem in our layer.
I will do it as soon as RC0/M9 is available.

I think the error might go away when I port my plugin to the new manifest file,
but that would not solve this bug that might break Eclipses compatiblity with
older plugins.

Tried it with an added manifest file ( and without runtime.compatiblity.jar )...
same result, the startet does not find my application.

News:
I created a new M9 version of the RCP and suddenly the application starts
without an error. It seems that windows managed to miss a few files during my
last copy ( I did a diff on both versions ).

The update problem is gone too ( I'm using a plugin with a manifest at the
moment ), I will try later if the update problem is still happening without the
manifest.

The latest builds work for you now.  The other errors look to be caused by a 
bad download/install.  Please reopen if you see the original problem again.
